articles.title: 2021 Data Science Bootcamp
articles.contents:
Introduction
We are very excited to introduce a free data science bootcamp for high school students across the country. The bootcamp will run from June 28th- July 18th. Students that participate will complete a total of 15 hours of work per week. Five hours will be spent online with the staff, and 10 hours of work will be completed by the students on their own. By the end of this bootcamp, students will be able to do basic data science!

articles.title: Schedule
articles.description: Here is the schedule for each of the four weeks.
articles.contents:
Week 1
The first week will cover Visualization.
 
Week 2
The second week will cover Wrangling Data.
 
Week 3
The third week will cover Data.
 
Week 4
Thee last week will consist of projects that the students will make.

articles.title: Staff
articles.description: Meet the staff members of the 2021 Summer Data Science Bootcamp!
articles.contents:
David Kane



David Kane is the Preceptor in Statistical Methods and Mathematics in the Department of Government at Harvard University. For further background on David Kane, visit here.
 
Becca Gill



Becca Gill is an incoming freshman of the class of 2025 at Yale University. To view Becca’s GitHub page, visit here.
 
Dario Anaya



Dario Anaya a rising senior at Andrean High School in Merrillville, Indiana.
 
Nosa Lawani



Nosa Lawani is a student in the class of 2024 at Harvard University. To view Nosa’s GitHub page, visit here.
